unnormalised: Education Technology: Adaptive Learning Gains Traction in India
normalised: education technology: adaptive learning gains traction in India

unnormalised: New Delhi, India - Adaptive learning platforms are increasingly being adopted by Indian educational institutions to personalize the learning experience for students. Experts at IIT Delhi are actively researching and developing AI-powered adaptive learning modules designed to cater to the diverse learning styles prevalent among Indian students.
normalised: new delhi, India - adaptive learning platforms are increasingly being adopted by Indian educational institutions to personalize the learning experience for students. experts at I I T delhi are actively researching and developing A I powered adaptive learning modules designed to cater to the diverse learning styles prevalent among Indian students.

unnormalised: These platforms, which adjust the difficulty and pace of learning based on individual performance, are seen as a potential solution to bridge the learning gap observed in many classrooms across the country. "Like tailoring a 'lehenga' to fit perfectly, adaptive learning tailors education to each student," says Professor Sharma of IIT Delhi, drawing a parallel to the intricate process of Indian tailoring.
